Remove from oven and scoop out the pulp from the halves and combine with the pineapple and cinnamon mixture. Replace the squash into the shells and return to the oven and bake for 7 minutes more until pineapple is hot and bubbly.

In a large skillet sprayed with butter-flavored cooking spray, brown meat and onion. Add meat and saute until browned, about 3 minutes. Add consomme, vinegar and sour cream. Bring to a boil, then immediately reduce heat to low. Add meat to mushroom mixture, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, or until meat is tender.

Preheat oven to 350f. Season chicken fillets with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Wrap each fillet in 1 strip of bacon and place in a 9x13x2-inch baking dish. In a small bowl, mix the sour cream and soup. Spoon mixture over the chicken and bake uncovered for 40 to 50 minutes or until slightly brown on top. Serve with hot cooked rice, if desired.

In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook garlic until tender and fragrant but not browned, about 1 minute. Add shrimp and mix well. Pour in stock and bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce heat and simmer gently for 20 to 25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large, heavy skillet over medium-high heat, brown beef, and drain fat. Mix in dry taco seasoning. Spoon browned meat into a 9x13 inch glass baking dish. Spoon a layer of refried beans over meat, then salsa. Top with shredded cheese. Bake about 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 8x8 square pan. Melt butter and cool slightly and add milk and beaten egg, set to the side. In bowl, sift the next four ingredients, 2 times. Add butter, milk, and egg mixture and stir only enough to smooth out any lumps. Combine the remaining sugar and cinnamon for the topping, in a small bowl or in a ziploc bag. Pour batter into greased pan and sprinkle the mixture of sugar and cinnamon over the top and bake 12 to 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Remove the stems from the caps, chop off the ends, and cut into large pieces. Mix the olive oil with the garlic, herbs and seasonings in an ovenproof casserole dish large enough to fit all of the mushrooms. Add the mushrooms, and mix well, coating the mushrooms with the flavored oil. Bake for about 30 to 40 minutes, or until cooked through. Remove from the heat, and drizzle with the balsamic vinegar.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Place tuna in 8-inch baking dish and set aside. In a small cup or bowl mix together next 3 ingredients and pour over tuna. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle with salt, parsley and green onion.

In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, yellow pear tomatoes, fresh lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, flax seed oil, dijon mustard, garlic clove, fresh dillpreparation:In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, yellow pear tomatoes, fresh lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, flax seed oil, dijon mustard, garlic clove, fresh dillpreparation:In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, yellow pear tomatoes, fresh lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, flax seed oil, dijon mustard, garlic clove, fresh dillpreparation:In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, yellow pear tomatoes, fresh lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, flax seed oil, dijon mustard, garlic clove, fresh dillpreparation:In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, yellow pear tomatoes, fresh lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, flax seed oil, dijon mustard, garlic clove, fresh dillpreparation:In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, yellow pear tomatoes, fresh lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, flax seed oil, dijon mustard, garlic clove, fresh dillpreparation:In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, yellow pear tomatoes, fresh lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, flax seed oil, dijon mustard, garlic clove, fresh dillpreparation:In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, yellow pear tomatoes, fresh lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, flax seed oil, dijon mustard, garlic clove, fresh dillpreparation:In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, yellow pear tomatoes

Place bananas in blender and blend until smoothie reaches desired consistency. The blender may need to be jiggled at the beginning as there is no liquid in the bottom. Place ice cubes in blender and blend until smoothie reaches desired consistency. Place

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place all ingredients into a large mixing bowl and mix until just moistened. Spoon into lined or nonstick, sprayed mini muffin pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove muffins from the tray and cool on a wire rack.

In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups flour, yeast, sugar, salt and pepper. Mix well in a saucepan, heat milk, water and shortening until warm. Add cheese and enough flour to make a firm dough. Knead well on a floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Beat 3 minutes at medium speed. By hand, add cheese and enough flour to make a firm dough. By

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl pour stuffing mix and water. Open chicken breasts, and if they are too thick to fold in half flatten and stretch them by placing on cutting board and using heavy rolling pin roll out chicken until it is able to be folded in half. Give the stuffing a quick mix with a spoon. Spoon stuffing onto one half of the chicken and fold chicken breast over to cover. Place breasts in baking pan. Continue stuffing breasts until all breasts are used. If you have left over stuffing go back and open breasts and continue stuffing until all stuffing is used. Combine soup and sour cream. Spread over chicken. Cover and bake for 45 minutes to an hour until chicken is thoroughly cooked.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly spray a baking sheet with vegetable oil spray and set aside. Sprinkle mayonnaise, water and hot pepper sauce in shallow bowl, mixing well. Dip fish in mayonnaise mixture and then dredge in bread crumbs. Place fish on greased baking sheet and bake in oven 17-18 or until fish flakes easily. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 325- 350 degrees. Spread balsamic roasted pears with butter. Combine sugar, cinnamon, and butter and mix well with fingers. Add lemon juice and stir well with a spoon. Sprinkle mixture evenly over fruits. Bake 30- 35 minutes and serve warm with cream.
Heat oven to 350f. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Bake for 20 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Heat 1 t oil in a ovenproof skillet until it just shimmers. Add the salmon skin side down and cook until the skin begins to crisp, about 2-3 minutes. Mound the salt around and over each piece, trying to get it to really make a cohesive crust on each one. Roast in oven for 5 minutes per inch of thickness. Remove the salmon from the oven and let sit for 2 minutes in the crust. Carefully brush away the salt. Transfer to a clean work surface and finish removing salt with a pastry brush. Season with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil, fresh ground black pepper, and serve with a little lemon. The salmon will seem a little dry but will not be overcooked. This really brings out the flavor of the salmon.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the butter, white wine, lemon juice, garlic, and parsley. When the butter melts completely, remove from heat. Arrange shrimp in a shallow baking dish. Pour the butter mixture over the shrimp. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes or until the shrimp are pink and opaque. Serve over rice or pasta.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake leek casserole for 1 hour.

Heat the sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the ginger root, rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper, and stir fry for 5 - 10 seconds, or until the ginger root is well browned. Remove the skillet from the heat and let the oil cool to room termperature. Pour the gari over the ginger root, rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper, and stir fry for 5 - 10 seconds, or until the ginger root is well browned. Pour the gari over the ginger root

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease a standard size bundt pan, 9 x 13-inch baking pan, or two 9-inch cake pans. In a large bowl, mix together the butter, whipping cream and brown sugar for 3 minutes, stirring. When slightly cooled, pour over cake. Bake for 45 minutes. For glaze, cook together the butter, whipping cream and brown sugar for 3 minutes, stirring. Bake for

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium high heat. Add orzo and saute until golden brown. Add scallions and saute quickly. Add chicken broth, water, salt & pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook for 17-20 minutes. I finished by adding a little extra butter and salt and pepper to taste.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add in spinach and chopped garlic. Saute stirring for about 10-12 minutes or until all the liquid from the spinach evaporates. Add in the breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese. Mix to combine and heat through. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut off the ends of the brussels sprouts and pull off any yellow outer leaves. Mix them in a bowl with the olive oil, salt, and lemon-pepper seasoning. Transfer them to a sheet pan and roast for 35 to 40 minutes, until crisp outside and tender inside. Shake the pan from time to time to brown the brussels sprouts evenly. Sprinkle with more kosher salt, if you like, and serve hot.

In a heatproof bowl, whisk together the eggs and sugar until combined. Place over a pan of gently simmering water. Gradually add all remaining ingredients. Whisk over low heat 10-15 minutes, until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a wooden spoon. Do not boil. Pour into sterilised jars and seal. The bottles can be stored in a cool place but must be refrigerated once opened.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place entire bag of popcorn kernels into a large roaster. In a large saucepan, cook together butter, brown sugar and corn syrup for 2 minutes after butter has melted and it starts to gently boil. Add baking soda to mixture. This will cause mixture to foam - that is why you need a large saucepaan. Allow to foam to cook down slightly. Pour caramel mixture over popcorn kernels and stir until mixed. Place in oven for 35-45 minutes,, stirring at least every 10-15 minutes. Remove from oven and pour on wax paper. Allow to cool slightly and break apart.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line pastry shell with foil and bake 5 minutes. Remove foil and bake 5 additional minutes. Remove from oven and reduce temperature to 325 degrees. In a bowl, stir together eggs, milk, onion, salt, pepper, nutmeg. Add vegetables or meat and stir. Toss shredded cheese with flour and add to egg mixture, stirring well. Pour into pastry shell and bake for 35 to 40 minutes.

Place all ingredients in a sauce pot. Cook on high heat until mixture starts to boil. Stirring occasionally until cranberries pop. Lower heat to medium and using the back of a large wooden spoon, squeeze the grapes against the side of pot or use a potato masher to pop grapes, leaving some whole. The pectin from the grapes and sugar will thicken the sauce as well as the heat the reducing the mixture.

Mix ingredients in the order listed batter will be very thick mix until all dry ingredients are incorporated, but try not to over mix, and fold in butterscotch chips as gently as possible. Press batter down into a greased 9 x 13 pan with the back of a large spoon to even out. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar evenly. Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes, until just beginning to brown on top. Allow to cool before cutting to prevent crumbling.
Heat oil and saut garlic. Add pork and stir-fry until pork is lightly browned. Add garlic and stir-fry until thickened. Serve spooned over rice.

In a large pot filled with boiling water, blanch potatoes for 10 seconds. With a slotted spoon, transfer potatoes to colander to cool. Peel, seed and quarter potatoes. In a large pot filled with boiling water, blanch potatoes for 10 seconds. Peel, seed and

Heat oil in large frying pan. Saute chicken and onion until chicken is no longer pink & onions are translucent. Add cream, mushrooms, paprika & chicken base. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5-7 minutes or until chicken is tender. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream. Mixture will be somewhat thin, but should be a creamy texture like the consistency of a white sauce. Serve hot with warmed flour tortillas and spanish rice.

In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except bread and butter. Mix until the cornstach is disolved. Transfer mixture to a shallow bowl or pan. Dip both sides of each bread slice into the mixture. Melt butter on the griddle or skillet. Place bread on heated surface and cook each side to a light golden brown. Serve immediately.

In a food processor or blender, blend the cream cheese, feta cheese green onion, pepper and oregano, until smooth, scrape down the sides, add the tablespoon of either yogurt or sour cream. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Rinse the cherry tomatoes and remove stems. With a sharp knife, cut a slice fron the non-stem end of each tomato. With a small spoon scoop out as much of the seeds and pulp and you can, arrange the hollow tomatoes on paper towel lines plate to drain. After the cheese mixture has chilled for 1 hour, transfer the it to a small zipper-top plastic bag, squeeze out air. Snip off one corner, squeeze the cheese filling into each tomato, arrange on serving dish and sprinkle with paprika.

Heat oven to 375. Stir together cracker crumbs, flour and baking powder. Set aside. Beat sweetened condensed milk and butter until smooth. Add in dry mixture, mixing well. Stir in chocolates, candy, coconut and pecans. Drop by rounded tbsp onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 1 minute. Remove from cookie sheet to wire racks. Cool completely.

Heat oil in 2-quart saucepan. Add onion and garlic. Cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes, until onion wilts. Stir in cumin and pepper. Continue to cook for 2-3 minutes. Add oregano, potatoes, green chilies and chicken broth. Bring to a boil and simmer slowly for 45 minutes. Serve hot with cheese sprinkled in the middle of bowl.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a food processor, combine the cheese and butter. Process until the mixture is smooth. Add the scallions and pulse until combined. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Spread the cheese mixture on the cut sides of the bread. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 10 to 12 minutes until golden. Remove from oven and serve immediately.

In a large skillet, heat the oil and gently fry the pork and green beans for 5 mins until soft. Add the chopped tomatoes and vegetable stock and bring to the boil. Reduce heat and cook out for 35-40 mins stirring occasionally. Meanwhile, in a saucepan fry the pork and green beans until crispy.

Place chicken breast halves in a resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. For marinade, stir together lime peel, lime juice, cooking oil, dried thyme, black pepper, salt, garlic cloves, salsa, lime wedgepreparation:Place chicken breast halves in a resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. For marinade, stir together lime peel, lime juice, cooking oil, dried thyme, black pepper, salt

Place lime wedge on glass rim of 3 glasses to moisten them. Dip the rims into the salt to lightly coat the edges of the glasses. Place the glasses in the freezer to chill. Place the ice, water, limeade concentrate and lime juice in the container of a blender. Process until combined and slushy. Pour into the prepared glasses. Garnish each glass with a lime slice, if desired. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 400f. Saut salmon and chive in butter until tender. Add salt to taste. Beat eggs and milk together in small bowl. Sprinkle parmesan in bottom of well greased muffin trays or pie dish. Layer salmon and chive in bottom of well greased muffin trays or pie dish. Layer salmon and chive in bottom of well greased muffin tr

Mix all remaining ingredients except the cream cheese together and pour over the bread. Stuff randomly with chunks of the cream cheese. Refrigerate overnight and bake at 350 for 45-60 minutes. Dust with powdered sugar and serve with assorted warm syrups.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the butter, white wine, lemon juice, garlic, and parsley. When the butter melts completely, remove from heat. Arrange shrimp in a shallow baking dish. Pour the butter mixture over the shrimp. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes or until the shrimp are pink and opaque, reduce heat. Remove shrimp and set aside. Add garlic and cook 2-3 minutes. Do not allow garlic to brown - it will make it bitter. Add white wine, and lemon juice. Cook until wine is reduced by half. After it is reduced, add italian seasoning. Reduce heat to low, and add butter. If pan is too hot, the butter will separate. Add shrimp back into sauce, add parsley, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 deg. In saucepan, combine raspberries and sugar. Mix well. Mixture should thicken. Add water and lemon juice. Stir until smooth. Cook and stir 1-2 minutes longer or until thickened. Remove from the heat. Cool clightly. Pour into crust. Refrigerate for 3 hours or until set. Spread with whipped topping.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray an 11 x 17-inch pan with pam non stick cooking spray. Combine flour and baking soda in bowl and set aside. Cream butter with sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Alternately stir in raisins and flour mixture. Fold in remaining ingredients. Spread evenly in prepared pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool and then cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray 2 loaf pans with non stick coating. In a large bowl, mix flour, splenda, baking powder, and salt. In a separate bowl mix together the eggs and egg whites, canola oil, and the grated zucchini. Stir the liquid mixture into the flour mixture. The dough will be somewhat thick. Stir until the flour mixture is just moistened. Spread evenly into the loaf pans. Bake 50 minutes.

In a saucepan, combine butter, sugar, egg, self rising flour, vanilla, orange, zest of, orange juice, cocoa powder, water. Bring to a boil over medium heat and continue. Stirring until thick. Remove from heat and add margarine and vanilla.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture then add chocolate chips. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream the butter and sugar. Add the dry ingredients. Mix everything together and roll into little balls. Put onto a greased baking tray, pressing the balls down very slightly with a fork. Bake at 350f and 180c for 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack and keep in an airtight container once cold.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the first seven ingredients. Transfer to a baking dish. Mix cracker crumbs and parmesan cheese together, then add in the butter and butter. Mix to combine, then sprinkle over top. Bake uncovered for 45-50 minutes or until heated through.

Place all ingredients in a food processor and blend until very smooth. Chill at least a few hours before tasting. Can serve with chips, crackers, or as a veggie dip. Keeps well in fridge. Cooking time listed is for chilling time.

Combine heavy cream, whole milk, brown sugar, honey, gingerroot, egg yolks and mix well. Pour into serving cups and top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with a little cinnamon and nutmeg and serve with a cinnamon stick.

Place all ingredients in a food processor fitted with a metal blade and process just until mixture is powdery -- about 30 seconds. Be careful not to overprocess. Store in an airtight container for up to 6 months. To make aztec hot chocolate, combine 1 cup of milk and 2 tablespoons of the mix in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, stirring constantly until mixture is powdery -- about 30 seconds. Be careful

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large saucepan, cook turkey and onions until chicken is no longer pink. Add taco seasoning mix, tomatoes, corn, and chiles. Cook over medium heat until chicken is no longer pink.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Grease a 13x9x2 inch pan. Unroll dough. Press in bottom and 1 inch up sides of greased pan. Fold the 1 inch of dough over and around the cheese. Press dough edges to seal. Brush edge with melted butter and parmesan cheese. Top the crust with sauce, pepperoni and cheese. Bake at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 15 to 18 minutes or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 400. Brush a 13 x 9 inch baking dish with olive oil. Layer the sliced pork chops, mushrooms, and onions, in the dish. Sprinkle with the salt and sage leaves. Pour the cream over evenly. Brush the pork chops with olive oil, and rub the breadcrumbs onto both sides of each pork chop. Place pork chops on top of potatoes. Bake, uncovered, for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or just until the pork chops are cooked through and the potatoes are tender.

Heat grill to high, rub mushrooms with oil. Grill for 3 minutes each side or till cooked but still firm. Mix cheese, garlic, butter, salt and pepper together in a bowl. Spoon mixture into mushrooms. Grill until cheese melts. Place in toasted buns with salad. This could also be done in the oven.

Bring to boil water and sugar. Remove from heat and add instant. Coffee. Bring to boil again. Remove from heat and add vanilla extract. Cool before adding rum. Put in bottles and cork. Makes about 3 fifths.

Heat the ghee or oil in a large pan and stir-fry the onion over moderate heat until crisp and light brown. Do not burn. Add the curry powder, chili, and the cooked meat or fish and mix well. Add the salt and water and cook for 5 minutes as a rich, brown sauce develops. Serve warm with rice.

Preheat oven to 450. Put oil in 9x13 pan, swirl around. Scrub potatoes. Cut each lengthwise into 8 wedges. Combine flour and seasonings in a bowl or baggie. Add potato wedges and shake or toss to coat. Arrange skin-side-down in oiled pan. Bake 35-40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Prepare filling by mixing refried beans, chilies, cumin and garlic together in a bowl. Spoon approximately 4 ounces bean filling into the center of each tortilla and top with about one tablespoon of cheese. Fold in ends and then sides. Place burritos seam side down on baking sheets that have been sprayed with vegetable oil spray. Bake for 2025 minutes until golden brown.

Place broccoli in a steamer basket and set in a saucepan over 1 inch of boiling water. Cover and steam just until tender, approx. 5 minutes. To prepare the sauce, combine the orange juice, honey and ginger in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Add the cornstarch mixture and bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Cook the sauce until thickened, about 1 minute. Remove the pan from the heat. Stir in the lemon juice and the sesame oil. Arrange the broccoli in a serving bowl. Top with the sauce, sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a plastic bag, combine flour, salt and pepper. Shake to coat chicken with flour mixture. Melt butter in casserole dish or skillet. Brown chicken on all sides. Mix in sour cream, broth, mushrooms and paprika. If skillet is not oven proof, transfer to a casserole dish. Cover and bake 45 minutes or until chicken is tender.

In a small mixing bowl, combine whole milk, sugar, lemon, zest of, sugar, low-fat cream cheese. Cover and process until smooth, about 1 minute. Transfer to a large bowl. In small mixing bowl, beat whole milk, sugar, lemon, zest of, sugar, low-fat cream cheese

In lg skillet, melt butter and cook scallops for about 7 minutes, until golden brown. Remove and keep warm. In same skillet, add garlic, butter, sherry, mushrooms, scallions, parsley, scallops, flour, half-and-halfpreparation:Combine garlic, butter, sherry, mushrooms, scallions and parsley in a saucepan. Saute 2 minutes over medium heat. Add scallops, stir and simmer 2 minutes. Add flour, stir to incorporate. Slowly add the half and half stirring until thickened and scallops are tender. Serve in a bowl or over rice.

Preheat oven to 325f. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs and sugar until very thick. The batter should fall from the beaters in a thick ribbon. Beat in the vanilla. While youre beating the eggs and sugar, heat the hot chocolate and butter in a small saucepan to just simmering. Add the hot chocolate mixture to the egg mixture in a slow, steady stream as you continue beating. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients, stirring until theyre just combined. Pour the batter into a lightly greased 9 inch cake round. Bake for 50 minutes, or until the cake is a deep golden brown and starting to pull away from the sides of the pan. Remove the cake from the oven and cool it in the pan for 10

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Put the first 7 ingredients into a food processor bowl. Pulse until bread is very coarsely chopped, 4-6 times. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish and arrange the cherry tomatoes in a single layer. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake until crust is browned and tomatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Drain pineapple, reserving juice. Mix pineapple chunks, mandarin oranges, bananas & marshmallows together. Gently fold in pudding mixture. Lastly, fold in cool whip. Cover and refrigerate.

Cook noodles according to package directions, or until of desired consistency, drain. Meanwhile, in a large pot combine all remaining ingredients. Stir in the cooked noodles. Bring to a full boil over high heat, stirring occasionally. Boil for about 10 minutes. Sprinkle each serving with chopped green onions if desired.

In a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat, saute the spinach and garlic in the oil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Transfer to a platter in the same pan, heat the wine and saute the celery or bok choy and mushrooms, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Add the rice, scallions and spinach. Heat through. Season with soy sauce or tamari.

Heat oven to 425. Heat oven to 425. Place chicken in a 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper to taste. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Bake, uncovered, at 325-degrees for 1 hour or until tender and cooked through.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the broccoli floret, celery, black olives, red onion, ham, cheddar cheese, tri-color spiral pasta, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian dressing, italian

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil and half of the butter in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Spread the flaked almonds over a small plate. Sprinkle 2 slices of bread with chocolate, and top each with another slice. Dip sandwiches into egg mixture, then press into the almonds, to coat. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil and half of the butter in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Sprinkle 2 slices of bread with chocolate

Put custard in a large bowl. In a large bowl, beat 1 tablespoon of sugar and 1 tablespoon of milk together until smooth. Add 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon stick and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla. Mix until smooth. Mix until
Preheat oven to 350f. Spray 13x9 pan with cooking spray. Drain butter beans and pour into pan. Add all other ingredients and mix well. Bake for 1 hour or until brown and bubbling.

Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add spinach, soy sauce, vinegar and sugar. Stir fry 2 minutes until spinach begins to wilt. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Grease a 9 x 13 inch pan. Combine first seven ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in green chilies and red bell pepper. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until it is lightly browned and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

Heat 2 tbsp oil in pan. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente. Reduce heat and stir in salt, pepper, cream, pesto, and parmesan cheese. Cook until chicken is no longer pink inside,. Stir in cooked pasta.

Preheat oven to 400. With the top of a sharp knife, make deep little slits all over the tenderloin and insert the garlic slivers. Season with salt, pepper and cumin. Place the oil in an oven-proof skillet and sear the tenderloin well over medium-high heat for about 10 minutes, turning the meat over as it browns. Add the chicken broth and white wine to the pan, and place it in the oven for 10 minutes. Remove it and let it rest, covered with foil, for 10-12 minutes before carving. Slice and serve immediately.

Heat oil. Add onions& sugar, cover and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 20- 25 minutes or until the onions are slightly coloured. Sprinkle flour over onions& stir in. Slowly add the beer, pour in chicken stock and season to taste. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Place toast slices in ovenproof soup bowls. Pour broth into each bowl, sprinkle with some parsley& top with grated cheese. Place under broiler for a couple of minutes to melt cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large skillet over medium heat melt butter. Add the pecans - saute until lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Add the brown sugar and cook until caramelized. Stir in the paprika, chile powder and cumin. Add the vinegar and cook until all the liquid has evaporated. Season with salt. Spread the pecans on a cookie sheet and bake in an oven until crisp, about 3 to 5 minutes.

Preheat grill on high for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, over medium heat, combine brown sugar, apple juice, vegetable oil, soy sauce, ginger, salt and pepper to taste, bring to a boil. In a measuring cup or small bowl, whisk cornstarch into the water and mix into brown sugar mixture. Cook, stirring constantly until bubbling and thickened. Reduce grill to medium-high heat. Grill chops on oiled grill, brushing often with brown sugar glaze, about 6-8 minutes per side, or until digital thermometer inserted sideways into the center of each chop reads 160f do not over cook.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f. Put the first 7 ingredients into a food processor bowl. Pulse until bread is very coarsely chopped, 4-6 times. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish and arrange the cherry tomatoes in a single layer. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake until crust is browned and tomatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish with nonstick pan coating or grease lightly with solid shortening. Cut baked potatoes into 1 inch cubes. Place half in a prepared baking dish. Sprinkle half of the salt, pepper and bacon. Top with half of the sour cream & cheese. Repeat layers. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with chopped green onions to garnish.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cut chicken in half. Arrange, skin side up, in a roasting pan. Combine butter, lemon juice, and spices in a small bowl and mix well. Brush chicken with mixture. Roast until juices run clear. Broil 6 inches from heat for 3 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a large glass baking dish with foil,. Put the ground beef in a large bowl and add the onion and garlic, knead together, add bread crumbs and italian seasoning -- mix all together. Add the egg and milk -- knead together well with hands --. Form pieces of meat into 1 inch balls, place in baking dish -- bake for about 20-30 minutes --. I usually put them in a large pan on the stove and cover with spaghetti sauce for a few minutes at medium heat, but thats optional.

Preheat oven to 400f. Put the chicken skin-side-up in a small roasting tin. Mix together the garlic, thyme and butter and dot over the chicken. Scatter around the red onions and pancetta and drizzle with oil. Roast for 20 minutes until the chicken has cooked through and the onions are softened. Divide the salad between 4 plates and top with the red onions, pancetta and chicken.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Put the potatoes in a large baking dish. Arrange the potatoes and the red and green peppers alternately in a spoke pattern in a shallow, 12-inch round baking dish. Pile the onions in the center. Scatter the garlic over the top. Drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with rosemary, salt and black pepper. Bake in the preheated oven until the vegetables are lightly golden and tender, or about 45 minutes. Garnish with fresh rosemary sprigs.

Place plum jam in a non-reactive saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring. Boil hard for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Take off the heat, stir in the pectin and ladle into hot sterilized jars. Seal and process in a hot water bath for 10 minutes. Place hot jars on a towel on your counter and let cool overnight. Remove from heat, stir in the pectin and ladle into hot sterilized jars. Place hot

In top of double boiler, melt butter, peanut butter and butterscotch chips. Remove from stove and cool until bottom of pan is touchable. Add marshmallows and nuts. Mix together. Place in a buttered pan and refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, toss the nuts with the maple syrup, olive oil, herbs and cayenne. Spread the nuts on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes., stirring occasionally, until browned. Season the nuts with salt and pepper and toss frequently until cooled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a plastic bag, combine flour, salt and pepper. Shake to coat chicken with flour mixture. Melt butter in casserole dish or skillet. Brown chicken on all sides. Mix in sour cream, broth, mushrooms and paprika. If skillet is not oven proof, transfer to a casserole dish. Cover and bake 45 minutes or until chicken is tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a greased 10 x 15 cookie sheet evenly with graham crackers. Combine brown sugar and butter and bring to a boil in microwave or on stovetop. Pour mixture over crackers and sprinkle with nuts and chips. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool in refrigerator. Cut or separate into bars.

Heat oven to 400. Place peppers in baking dish and cover with aluminum foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and bake uncovered for an additional 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cup of cheese. Spoon mixture into pepper halves and then place in 9 x 13 glass baking dish. Pour hot water in the bottom of the dish and cover with aluminum foil. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and bake

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Mix all ingredients, except salmon, together. Pour a small amount of the mix into the bottom of a baking pan - just enough to lightly cover the bottom. Add the salmon, and pour the remaining mix over top. Bake for about 20 minutes, or to your own preference.

Cover crock pot with aluminum foil, leaving enough to overlap potatoes when finished. Layer half of the potatoes, onions, potatoes and cheese in crock pot. Cover and cook on low setting for 8 to 9 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine cake mix, water and almond extract in large mixing bowl. Beat at low speed with mixer until moistened. Beat at medium speed for one minute. Line medium muffin pans with paper baking cups. Fill muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown, cracked and dry. Remove from muffin pans. Cool completely. Frost with frosting.

Boil potatoes in skins and cool, peel and grate. Combine with 4 tblsp butter, melted. Stir in cheese until almost melted. Blend with rest of the ingredients. Put in a 2 quart pan sprayed with cooking oil. Dot the top with 2 tblsp butter. Cover and bake at 300 about 25 minutes.

Place peas, onion, and cheese in a large salad bowl. In a small mixing bowl, stir together the sour cream and sugar until well blended. Add the sour cream mixture to the salad, then season with salt and pepper. Toss thoroughly with a large spoon. Place in refrigerator for several hours. Add the cashews just before serving, and toss well to thoroughly blend all ingredients.

In a saucepan over medium heat melt the butter, add old bay, minced onion, lemon juice, crabmeat, stir thoroughly. Add the flour, stirring constantly, and then gradually add the light cream, continuing to stir. Add the crabmeat and let simmer for about 15 minutes. Do not allow the soup to boil. Serve garnished with a dash of old bay and parsley flakes.

In a small saucepan, combine the pomegranates, orange juice, sugar, lemon juice, oranges, strawberry, mint leaf. Set pan over medium-high heat and bring to boil. Boil 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until mixture reduces to 2 tablespoons. Strain mixture though fine sieve to remove zest. Place melon in bowl, toss with ginger-lime mixture. Let sit for 15 minutes. You can drain the sauce or serve it with the melon.

In a large saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a light boil. Cook and stir for 2 mins. Pour into a large container. Add pineapple juice, concentrates and extract. Cover and freeze. Remove from freezer 1-2 hours before serving. Just before serving, mash the mixture with a potato masher and stir in lemon-lime soda.
Heat oil in a saute pan over medium high heat. Add onion, garlic, rosemary, salt, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. Saute for 30-45 minutes, depending on the size of the loaves.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a dutch oven, brown hamburger meat. Drain off fat. In the dutch oven, top meat with all of the sliced onions, then the potatoes. Salt the potatoes. Top with shredded cheese. Combine soup and soup can of water in a bowl and blend with spoon until smooth. Bake covered at 350 for about an hour.

Preheat oven to 350f grease bottom only of a 9 x 13 pan with shortening or cooking spray. Mix cake mix, buter and egg whites and milk in a large bowl with a spoon. Stir in orange zest, powdered sugar and cream cheese. Spread evenly in pan. Bake for 20 to 22 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Cool completely, about 1 hour. Cut and serve. Makes about 24 bars.

Preheat oven to 160c with the fan or 180c if not using a fan forced oven. Slice the tomatoes in half lengthways and place in a shallow baking dish. Pour over the olive oil and toss tomatoes to coat. Check the tomatoes are sitting cut side up and sprinkle with dried basil and sea salt. Bake in the oven 30 minutes.

Heat oil and butter in a large skillet. Add garlic and shrimp. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Saute 2-3 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Turn shrimp with spatula. Cook shrimp 2 minutes longer on other side. Remove shrimp to serving platter. Garnish with lemon wedges. We give this a little squirt with the lemon wedge.

Heat oven to 400 f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook 1 minute. Discard garlic. Add onion and cook until softened. Add tomatoes with juice, sausage and pepper flakes. Cook over medium high heat, until sauce is thickened. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and toss with tomato in large bowl. Toss with mozzarella. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and chopped parsley. Serve hot.

Use a deep pan or a regular fryer. Heat oil until you think it is hot enough. You can check with a cube of bread. Drain the cauliflower and let cool. Mix together in a bowl the bisquick, pesto, italian seasoning, pepper and cheese. Dip the cauliflower pieces into the egg and then coat with the batter. Fry until golden brown. As soon as you remove it from the fat, sprinkle it with more cheese.

Combine the dressing mixture and onion in a large bowl. Whisk together the mustard, white vinegar, and salt in a medium bowl. Blend thoroughly. Pour dressing mixture over coleslaw mix and toss to coat. Chill at least 2 hours before serving.

In a large saucepan over medium-low heat, saute the garlic until aromatic. Add the tomatoes, and saute for another minute or so, then add the broth. Scramble the egg, parmesean cheese, hot sauce, salt and pepper in a serving bowl. When the broth comes to a boil, add the egg mixture while stirring. Remove from heat, place in a bowl, top with fresh ground pepper, and enjoy.

In a small saucepan, heat butter and oil over medium-high heat. Saute onion until softened, about 5 minutes. Add couscous, curry powder, cumin, cayenne pepper, couscous, chicken broth, salt, pepper and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add chicken broth, stir to incorporate, and bring to boiling point. Cover pan, remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff couscous with a fork, and add all ingredients except the tomatoes. Season to taste with the salt and pepper. Slice a top off each tomato, and using a teaspoon, hollow out, remove and discard seeds. Fill each tomato with couscous mix, and replace top as a lid. Place stuffed tomatoes on a baking tray and bake for 15-20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Heat 1 t oil in a ovenproof skillet until it just shimmers. Add the salmon skin side down and cook until the skin begins to crisp, about 2-3 minutes. Mound the salt around and over each piece, trying to get it to really make a cohesive crust on each one. Roast in oven for 5 minutes per inch of thickness. Remove the salmon from the oven and let sit for 2 minutes in the crust. Carefully brush away the salt. Transfer to a clean work surface and finish removing salt with a pastry brush. Season with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil, fresh ground black pepper, and serve with a little lemon. The salmon will seem a little dry but will not be overcooked. This really brings out the flavor of the salmon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, mix together peaches, marmalade, lemon juice, ginger, mustard, cinnamon and soy sauce. Place pork in medium baking dish. Glaze pork with peach mixture, using it all. Roast in oven for approximately one and a half hours. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Place fish in baking pan. Mix fish fillets, peanut oil, red spanish onion, red capsicum, broccoli floret, prawns, hokkien noodles, teriyaki marinade. Bake for 10 minutes. Pour remaining fish fillets over. Bake another 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. Sprinkle with

Place green beans in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until crisp-tender. Meanwhile, in a skillet, saute mushrooms, onion and garlic in oil until tender. Stir in water chestnuts and seasonings. Heat through. Drain beans and stir into skillet. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat over to 375f. Dredge filets in butter. Dredge filets in bread crumbs. Dredge filets in minced garlic. Sprinkle with seasoning salt. Spay small casserole dish add filets and bake covered with foil for 25 minutes. Uncover and broil for 3 or more minutes, depending on if ya want them crispier. Good served with rice and veggie of your choice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place all ingredients into a large mixing bowl and mix until just moistened. Spoon into lined or nonstick, sprayed muffin pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove muffins from the tray and cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In an ovenproof saucepan or dutch oven, heat oil on medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, and jalapeos and cook, stirring, 4 minutes. Add rice and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, stir, and cover. Place in oven and bake until rice is tender, about 50 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving.

In a large saucepan, stir together the cocoa and sugar. Add water. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Allow to boil for two minutes, still stirring. Add milk and orange peel and heat to serving temperature. Add vanilla and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 12-cup muffin pan. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine spaghetti, eggs, parmesan cheese, and pepper. Evenly press mixture into muffin cups to form a crust. Evenly top each cup with pasta sauce, then mozzarella cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until bubbling. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add eggs, bacon, onion, green pepper, red pepper, cheddar and colby cheese. Beat with wire whisk until smooth. In the meantime, in large mixing bowl, crack and add the dozen eggs, salt and pepper to taste, one heaping tablespoon of sour cream. Pour over the ham and vegetable mixture in the skillet. Sprinkle the top with the cheese. Stir as it cooks until the eggs are no longer shiny.

Place chickpeas, red peppers, garlic, feta cheese, hot red pepper sauce, pepper, salt & pepper. Toss thoroughly. Taste, and add more oil if desired. Scatter chickpeas, red peppers, garlic, feta cheese, hot red pepper sauce, pepper, salt & pepper. Scatter chickpeas, red

In a medium-size pot, bring water to a boil. Stir in the spices, cover, and simmer over low heat for 5 minutes. Stir in the pre-brewed coffee. Meanwhile, in a saucepan, heat milk until almost boiling. Strain the coffee through a fine mesh strainer covered with cheesecloth into the milk. Add sweetener, stir, and serve in mugs.

Place potatoes in water and 1 tsp salt and simmer until tender, about 15 to 18 minutes. Drain and run under cold water to cool. Cut into quarters. Meanwhile, cook bacon in skillet untel crisp. Crumble when cooled. Whisk oil, vinegar, mustard, remaining salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Toss with the potatoes, bacon and parsley.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, beat the margarine, white and brown sugar together until fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla, beat well. In another bowl, sift flour, baking powder, and salt. Add to the creamed mixture, stirring well. Fold in butter brickle bits, and chocolate chips. Spread in a greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Can be frosted with chocolate frosting.

In a small saucepan, heat butter and oil over medium-high heat. Saute onion until softened, about 5 minutes. Add curry, cumin and cayenne, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Adjust heat to medium-high, add couscous, blend well and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add chicken broth, stir to incorporate, and bring to boiling point. Cover pan, remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork, season with salt if needed, and serve hot.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add the butter and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon, until melted. Remove from heat and set aside. Meanwhile, heat a panini maker or a grill pan over medium-high heat. Divide sausage mixture into 4 portions and mound each portion on one slice of bread. Top each with bocconcini slices and top with remaining bread slices. Lightly butter the outside of each panini. Cook until both sides of each panini are golden. Serve immediately. Serve warm and garnish with maple syrup and fresh fruit if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spread almonds onto a baking sheet in a single layer. Roast about 10 to 15 minutes, until slightly browned, tossing a couple of times for even browning. Let cool to touch. In a blender, mix or pulse the almonds with the walnut oil and salt. This can take about 10 minutes or so. Once smooth, spoon in honey and blend for 30 seconds to mix thoroughly. Spread on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes, until slightly browned, tossing a couple of times for even browning. Spread on an un

In a large nonstick saut pan over medium heat, combine cooked rice and whole milk. Heat until mixture begins to boil. Decrease heat to low and cook to a simmer, stirring frequently, until mixture just begins to thicken, approximately 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium, add heavy cream, coconut milk, sugar, and cardamom. Continue to cook until mixture just begins to thicken again, approximately 5-10 minutes. Use a whisk to prevent the cardamom from clumping. Once mixture begins to thicken, remove from heat and stir in raisins and pistachios. Transfer the mixture to individual serving dishes or a glass bowl and place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the pudding. Serve chilled or at room temperature. I like my rice pudding a little sweet, so i also added a little bit more sugar than the 2 oz. Called for in the recipe to suit my personal taste.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 12-cup muffin pan. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine spaghetti, eggs, parmesan cheese, and pepper. Evenly press mixture into muffin cups to form a crust. Evenly top each cup with pasta sauce, then mozzarella cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until bubbling. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In large, resealable plastic bag, or shallow glass container, combine the first seven ingredients and mix well. Add steak, turn to coat. Seal bag, or cover container, and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Drain and discard marinade. Grill, covered, over medium-hot coals for 6-8 minutes on each side, or until meat reaches desired doneness.

In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine rice, broth, and salt. Bring to a boil. Decrease heat to low and cook, covered, until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Meanwhile, in a small skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add in onion. Saute about 5 minutes, until tender. Stir sauteed onions into cooked rice. Add in parsley and fluff with a fork before serving.

In a large, heavy bottomed, skillet place the sugar and water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the almonds and cook, stirring constantly, until almost all the water has evaporated. About 5 minutes. Add the cinnamon and salt and cook until the sugar has dried on the almonds. About 2 minutes. Pour onto a large sheet pan and let cool.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add in spinach and chopped garlic. Saute stirring for about 10-12 minutes or until all the liquid from the spinach evaporates. Add in the breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese. Mix to combine and heat through. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper to taste.

Heat oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add minced garlic and lightly saute just until fragrant. Stir in the flour and stir for about one minute. This will be thick. Slowly pour in the milk. Add salt, pepper, oregano and nutmeg. Stir until creamy and thick. Turn off the heat and stir in nutritional yeast. Serve over your choice of pasta.

In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add flour and salt, blending well. Slowly add milk, stirring constantly. Cook until mixture boils and thickens. Set aside press corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta cheese, corn on the cob, water, chipotle chiles, salt, feta

Preheat oven to 350. Lay chips on oven safe platter. You will be layering this so split them. Warm beans and chili on stove or in microwave. Stir beans until smooth. Spread beans over tortillas. Top with onion, cheese, jalapenos, chili and cheddar cheese. Repeat by layering tortilla chips and toppings until gone. Place in oven and bake until cheese is melted. Dollop with sour cream. Add tomatoes and green onions on top.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. In a shallow dish, toss the asparagus, olive oil and salt and pepper together. Lay the asparagus in one level layer. Place in oven and roast, uncovered for approximately 10 minutes, or until the asparagus is just tender. Transfer to a serving plate. Whisk the lemon juice, lemon zest, dill, olive oil and honey together in a small bowl. Top the asparagus with some of the dressing and keep the rest on the side.

In a large skillet, saute the meat with garlic and ginger root in oil for a couple minutes. Add the curry paste, coconut milk, lime rind and juice. Simmer until meat is desired tenderness, or until tofu is heated through. Stir in the cilantro just before serving. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a bowl, mix the graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and butter with your hands. Press the mixture firmly into a 9-inch pie pan, and bake until brown, about 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool to room temperature before filling. Lower the oven temperature to 325 degrees f. In a separate bowl, combine the condensed milk, lime juice, and eggs. Whisk until well blended and place the filling in the cooled pie shell. Bake in the oven for 15 minutes and allow to chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Once chilled, combine the sour cream and powdered sugar and spread over the top of the pie using a spatula. Sprinkle the lime zest as a garnish on top of the sour cream and serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees celsius in a 9 inch springform pan in small bowl, blend butter and sugar, then add vanilla and egg. Beat well add flour, baking powder, and salt to butter mixture. Blend well. Spread dough over bottom and 1 inch up sides of pan. Over dough, arrange 5-6 peach slices in center to create a circular shape place rest of slices around center circle to create the effect of sunrays. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Bake 35-45 minutes cool 10 minutes then remove the sides of pan.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a medium mixing bowl stir together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed cream butter and sugars until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla. On low speed gradually add flour mixture and mix just until blended. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 9 to 12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degree f. In a large pot cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain and pou into lasagna glass casserole dish. Whisk eggs and stir into pasta, also mix in butter. Add in all cheeses and pour in milk stir around good. Cook for 1 hour in 350 degree oven until it looks like it getting crispy on top.

Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Brown chicken in two batches, 6 to 8 minutes. Set aside. In same skillet over medium heat, cook ginger, onion, and garlic, stirring until browned, 8 to 10 minutes. Add soy sauce, vinegar, and sugar. Cook over high heat until thick, 3 to 4 minutes. Add chicken. Stir to warm. Remove from heat. Stir in scallions.
Heat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all ingredients and mix well. Press mixture evenly into a loaf pan. Bake uncovered 1 to 1 hour. Let stand 5 to 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cut each biscuit in two, rolling into small balls. Layer rolled biscuit pieces in a bundt pan. Combine margarine and brown sugar in small sauce pan. Bring to a boil and allow to boil for 2 minutes. Pour caramel mixture over biscuits and bake for approximately 40-45 minutes, or until golden brown. Carefully invert bundt pan onto a serving dish. Sprinkle nuts on top and serve immediately.
Put in jars and refrigerate for 3 weeks.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cut up potatoes into wedges, rounds or thin strips. In a large bowl add the fries. Coat them with oil. You may substitute just water if desired. Then add the garlic granules, parmesan and sea salt. Spay a cookie sheet with pam or oil and lay fries out on top. Bake for 10 mins then turn them over. Put back in the oven for 10 more minutes. If you have thicker fries you may need an additional 5-10 minutes baking time.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Mix all ingredients in lg bowl. Mix well. Pour into crust. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 and bake another 40 min, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Garnish with whipped cream. Refrigerate leftovers.

In a large skillet, saute the chicken in oil until no longer pink. Stir in the soup, water, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stin in sour cream. Serve over toasted english muffins. Can also serve over cooked noodles. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper or paprika.

Spray a nonstick frypan with veggies cooking spray and heat to medium. Spray veggie cooking spray over both sides of the cod fillets. Sprinkle parsley, italian seasoning, salt and pepper over both sides of the cod fillets. Place cod into medium hot frypan, cook for about 5 minutes, carefully turn and cook a further 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve hot with the other 2 lemon sections for garnish.

Add the eggs, sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, honey graham crackers, hershey bar, miniature marshmallowpreparation:Add the eggs, sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, honey graham crackers, hershey bar, miniature marshmallowpreparation:Add the eggs, sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, honey graham crackers, hershey bar, miniature marshmallowpreparation:Add the eggs, sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, honey graham crackers, hershey bar, miniature marshmallowpreparation:Add the eggs, sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, honey graham crackers, hershey bar, miniature marshmallowpreparation:Add the eggs, sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, honey graham crackers, hershey bar, miniature marshmallowpreparation:Add the eggs, sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, honey graham crackers, hershey bar, miniature marshmallowpreparation:Add the eggs, sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, honey graham crackers, hershey bar, miniature marshmallowpreparation:Add the eggs, sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, honey graham crackers, hershey bar, miniature marshmallowpreparation:Add the eggs,

Heat oil in cast iron skillet until it reaches 350 or flour bubbles immediately upon being sprinkled in it. Place the soy sauce, butter, worcestershire sauce, canned oysters, salt, russet potato, low-fat milk, white pepper, ground nutmeg. Pour stew in a large serving soup bowl. Dust with paprika and sprinkle with parsley.

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Saute squash until browned, about 5 minutes. Add garlic. Saute 1 minute. Add water, salt and pepper. Simmer until squash is tender, 6-7 minutes. Stir in basil.

Heat oil over medium heat. Saut garlic until soft, being careful not to let it burn. Add sliced mushrooms and saut until they look fairly cooked and shiny. Add almonds and saut for a couple more minutes. Finally, add frozen green beans and splash of soy sauce. Stir frequently until beans are just cooked and, of course, no longer frozen. If not on the south beach diet or watching sugar intake, you could add oyster sauce or other asian condiment to the mixture.

Place tea bags and baking soda in a large heat resistant glass measuring cup. Add 2 cups of boiling water. Cover and steep for 15 minutes. Remove tea bags and pour tea into a 2 quart pitcher. Add 6 cups of cold water. If you have hard water, use filtered water or bottled water. For sweetened tea, put approximately 1 cup of sugar in 2 quart pitcher. Then pour tea concentrate from step 2, and after sugar has dissolved, add 6 cups of cold water. To avoid cloudiness, cool to room temperature before refrigerating. Garnish with lemon or mint and serve over ice. Store in refrigerator for up to 2 days.

In a large saucepan heat butter and olive oil over medium-low heat. Add onion and cook for three minutes. Add apple and cabbage, and cook for five minutes. Stir in vinegar, salt, pepper, and honey. Cover and cook for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until cabbage is soft.

In a small mixing bowl, thoroughly whisk together eggs, light cream, salt, pepper, worcestershire sauce. Heat a small skillet over medium low heat. Add egg mixture and cook, while stirring, so that the eggs do not set too fast. The eggs will begin to set and form a creamy sauce. Add in the remaining butter, one piece at a time, continuing to stir. Arrange the toasts on serving plates. Once the eggs set spoon them over the toast, season with pepper and the remaining herbs, and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400degf. Combine all ingredients on a large greased baking sheet. Arrange in a single layer. Roast in preheated oven for about 50 minutes, turning once during cooking, until potatoes are tender. Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes are tender, or about 45 minutes. Garnish with fresh rosemary sprigs.

Heat oil and butter in a large skillet. Add garlic and shrimp. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Saute 2-3 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Turn shrimp with spatula. Cook shrimp 2 minutes longer on other side. Remove shrimp to serving platter. Garnish with lemon wedges.

In a large wok or nonstick frying pan, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and ginger and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add scallops and stir to coat with garlic mixture, then cook 1 minute. Mix in snow peas and cook 1 minute. Stir in broth and soy sauce and cook just until simmering. Sprinkle with green onions and mix with noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Mix all ingredients, except salmon, together. Pour a small amount of the mix into the bottom of a baking pan - just enough to lightly cover the bottom. Add the salmon, and pour the remaining mix over top. Bake for about 20 minutes, or to your own preference.

Wash, core and dice celery. Sprinkle lemon juice over them and toss together gently to coat, then sprinkle brown sugar over the celery and toss again. Chill for at least 20 minutes. Add celery and nuts then stir in mayonnaise, adding only enough for desired consistency. Serve on a bed of greens.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Coat 8 muffin cups with pam. Mix sugar and cinnamon in small bowl. Dip each marshmallow in melted margarine and roll in sugar mix. Separate dough into triangles. Wrap one triangle around each marshmallow and pinch dough together. Place each one in a muffin cup. Drizzle extra margarine over rolls. Bake 8-12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425. Cut each potato lengthwise into 8 wedges. Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Toss potatoes with oil, sugar, chili powder, salt, and ground pepper, until coated. Place sweet potatoes, cut sides down, on baking sheet. Roast potatoes until browned and tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Season with additional salt, if desired, before serving.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Place pasta in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in parsley. Serve over pasta topped with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place pimento cheese on a lightly greased pizza pan and press out to 12 inches. Evenly distribute pimento cheese. Evenly distribute pimento stuffed olives. Top with the old bay seasoning, onions, bacon and mushrooms. Bake on the lowest rack for 20-25 minutes.

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray and cook turkey for 6 minutes. Drain. Add hot sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 3-5 minutes or until sauce is thickened and turkey is no longer pink in center. Place lettuce on warm tortillas and drizzle dressing on top. Roll up and serve.

Place tuna in a medium bowl and break into large pieces with a fork. Add tomatoes, onion, cilantro, lime juice, peppers, and salt. Stir to mix. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes or up to 6 hours. Line plates with lettuce leaves and top with tuna salad. Serve with chips.

In a large wok, heat oil with red pepper flakes over medium-high heat. Stir in green beans. Cook, stirring frequently, for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in garlic and ginger. Cook, stirring frequently, for 3 to 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, and then stir in black bean sauce. Cover and continue cooking until green beans are tender, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving.

In a medium sized bowl, combine all ingredients mixing well. If mixture looks a little too dry, add a little more mayonnaise until. Desired moistness is reached. Now taste to see if seasonings need to be adjusted. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours.

Heat oil in medium saute pan or saucepan over medium-high heat. Fry onion until crisp and reddish-brown, about 10 minutes, then drain on paper towels. Put garlic and chile in saucepan and fry for 20 seconds or until just beginning to brown. Add lentils and water. Partially cover and cook for 30-35 minutes, or until lentils are soft. Serve lentils with onions on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle cheese in 9x9 inch square baking dish. Dot with butter. Mix cream, mustard, salt, and pepper, and pour half of the mixture over the cheese. Pour eggs on top. Pour remaining cream mixture over the eggs. Bake 25 minutes.

Preheat oven at 350 degrees. Spread the marshmallow sauce over the top of the fruit plate. Bake for 15 minutes in 400 degree oven. Then pour mixture of beaten eggs and heavy cream over the top. Bake for 30 minutes longer in 400 degree oven. Bake for 30 minutes longer in

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place cream cheese in a medium sized mixing bowl. Saute onions in butter until softened. Add onions, seafood, wine and swiss cheese to cream cheese. Stir until combined. Spread into a greased 2 quart baking dish and top with cheddar cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbly and golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease tube pan. Mix first four ingredients in bowl. Separate biscuits into 20 pieces, then cut biscuits into 4 pieces. Toss biscuits with bacon and other ingredients. Put all this into tube pan and drizzle with butter. Bake for 25-30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray an 8-inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In a large bowl combine egg with melted butter. Whisk together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Combine with egg mixture. Pour in buttermilk and stir until just combined. Pour in buttermilk mixture. Pour in butterm

Heat oven to 350f. Blend together all the ingredients except the chicken. Brush the breasts all over with the marmalade mixture. Place in a baking dish lined with foil. Bake for 20-25 minutes until done, basting every 8 minutes. If there is any sauce left, heat, and serve along side the chicken. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place pie crust in a 9-inch tart pan and leave the sides long and free-form. Combine sugar and corn syrup. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Add pecans and vanilla, and teaspoon of melted butter and mix well. Set aside. Toss apples with lemon juice. Spread apples on bottom of pie crust and pour pecan mixture over apples. Fold edges of pie crust over filling. Bake pie until set, about 45 to 50 minutes.
Preheat oven to 325f. Mix ground beef, salt, worcestershire sauce, onion gravy mix, biscuit mix, milk, brown gravy mix, hot water. Bake for 1 hour in the 325f oven.

Combine ketchup, cider vinegar, orange juice, pineapple juice, wine vinegar, sugar, mustard, cornstarch, water. Set aside. In saucepan heat all remaining ingredients until sugar is dissolved and liquid is hot. Slowly add the ketchup, cider vinegar, orange juice, pineapple juice, wine vinegar, sugar, mustard, cornstarch, water. Slowly add the ketchup, cider vinegar, orange juice, pineapple juice, wine vinegar, sugar, mustard,

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Mix together dry ingredients. Stir in beaten eggs, butter, & milk. Add enough additional butter or oil to cover the bottom of a 9 or 10 inch cast iron skillet and place pan in hot oven. When the pan is very hot, remove from the oven & pour the cornbread batter into the skillet. Return to oven & bake approximately 15 minutes until browned. Cut into wedges to serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line 9 inch pie pan with pastry. In large bowl combine all filling ingredients except butter and toss lightly. Spoon filling into crust lined pan. Cut 4 slits in top of crust. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cover edge of crust with strips of foil after 20 minutes of baking to prevent excessive browning. Cover edge of crust with strips of foil after 20 minutes

Preheat oven to 400f. Place wax paper on a large baking sheet. Combine dry ingredients in a second bowl. Combine other ingredients in a second bowl. Blend the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Add butter and sugar. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes at 170 degrees celsius.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray cookie sheet with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine butter, sugars and vanilla. Beat in egg. Mix in flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir in oatmeal and chocolate chips until well blended. Bake at 350 degrees f. For about 8-10 minutes.

Heat oil in 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook turkey, onion, chilies and garlic in oil, stirring occasionally, until turkey is no longer pink in center and onion is tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Place the rice in a large bowl and add cold water to cover by 3 inches. Swirl around with your fingers until the water becomes cloudy, then pour through a strainer to drain. Repeat this process until the water remains clear. This will take 4 to 6 rinsings. Place the rice, salt and the 6 cups water in a deep, nonstick saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer the rice gently, uncovered, for about 18 minutes. When the rice has absorbed all the water, reduce the heat to the lowest possible setting and sprinkle the butter pieces over the top. Wrap a clean kitchen towel around the pot lid, piling any excess cloth on top of the lid. Place the cloth-covered lid over the rice and steam for 20 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat and let stand, covered, 5 minutes. Gently fluff the rice with a fork and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Mix first 4 ingredients with hand or stand mixer on medium until softened and well mixed. Add next two ingredients and mix on med-low until just incorporated. Transfer mixture to a small ovenproof dish and sprinkling cayenne on top to taste. Top with cheddar. Bake for 15 - 18 minutes or until bubbling around the edges. Remove from oven and allow to set for 5 - 7 minutes before serving. Serve with fried or baked pita wedges and tortilla chips.

In a 9 inch pie pan, combine eggs, whipping cream, tabasco sauce, tarragon, chicken base, fresh spinach, swiss cheese, parmesan cheese, ham. Whip until smooth. Arrange the pie shell in a 9 inch pie pan. Add the grated swiss cheese, spinach, ham and parmesan cheese. Pour the egg mixture over all and bake at 350 for 40-45 minutes.

In a large nonstick saut pan over medium heat, combine cooked rice and whole milk. Heat until mixture begins to boil. Decrease heat to low and cook to a simmer, stirring frequently, until mixture begins to thicken, approximately 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium, add heavy cream, coconut milk, sugar, and cardamom. Continue to cook until mixture just begins to thicken again, approximately 5-10 minutes. Use a whisk to prevent the cardamom from clumping. Once mixture begins to thicken, remove from heat and stir in raisins and pistachios. Transfer the mixture to individual serving dishes or a glass bowl and place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the pudding. Serve chilled or at room temperature. I like my rice pudding a little sweet, so i also added a little bit more sugar than the 2 oz. Called for in the recipe to suit my personal taste.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Spray a 9 inch pie plate with non stick vegetable spray. Add graham crumbs and shake the plate to coat the entire surface. Set aside. In a separate bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar and flour. Beat on medium speed until thoroughly mixed and creamy. Beat in sour cream, egg whites and vanilla. Pour mixture into graham crust and place in center of preheated oven. Bake 40 minutes. Remove from oven and cool on a rack. Refrigerate at least 3 hours before serving. Top with strawberries if desired.

Preheat oven to 425. Start frying bacon or sausage. Combine first 5 ingredients, then cut in butter. Make a well in the center and pour in milk. Stir until well combined and moist. Turn dough out onto floured surface and knead until dough holds together well and is pliable. Press into bottom of a greased 9 x 13 pan. Beat the eggs with a splash of milk and pour over biscuit crust. Sprinkle crumbled bacon or sausage over the egg mixture and top with cheese. Bake for 16 - 20 minutes, or until egg is cooked through.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. In a small bowl, combine paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper, black pepper and salt. Divide in half. In a medium bowl, combine half of spice mixture, sweet potatoes, olive oil and maple syrup. Toss to coat sweet potatoes thoroughly. Spread sweet potatoes onto foil-lined baking sheet into a single layer, leaving two spaces in the middle for the pork chops. Rub remaining half of spice mixture lightly over both sides of pork chops and nestle into spaces made in sweet potatoes. Roast for 35-40 minutes or until pork chops are done.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees celsius. Place chopped potatoes, shredded coconut, almonds, vanilla, powdered sugar, dark chocolate, macadamia nuts, and salt in a bowl and beat until light and creamy. Add eggs and beat well. Using a flat knife, mix through flours and coconut until a soft dough forms. Mix chocolate chips into the dough. Using your hands, mould two tablespoons of dough mixture into a flat round. Place rounds on a baking tray that is lined with non stick baking paper. Repeat until all the mixture is used. Bake for 10 minutes or until light golden. Allow to cool on trays.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Unroll crescent dough and place in a circle on round stone, with the wide ends in the middle and the pointed ends to the outside. You should have an circle in the middle of the stone. You will need to overlap the wide ends a bit to make a circle. Mix the remaining ingredients in a bowl, using more mayo if mixture appears to be dry. Place the mixture in a circle on the crescent rolls on the wide ends. Fold the pointed ends over the mixture to the middle of the stone. Tuck the ends under. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the crescent rolls are golden brown. Slice and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 12-cup muffin pan. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine spaghetti, eggs, parmesan cheese, and pepper. Evenly press mixture into muffin cups to form a crust. Evenly top each cup with pasta sauce, then mozzarella cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until bubbling. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Combine coffee and marshmellows in a pan cook on low til melted. Microwave might work too. Cool and fold in whipped cream. Spoon into an 8 x 8 inch pan and freeze for 3 hours until firm. Sprinkle top with chocolate shavings. Cut into squares and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a 9x13 pan with cooking spray. Press the meatloaf into the pan. Mix the ketchup, brown sugar and mustard together and spread over the meatloaf. Bake at 350 for about 50 minutes.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add rice and cook, stirring constantly. Sprinkle with salt, cumin, and taco seasoning. Cook stirring constantly, until slightly translucent. Stir in onions and cook until tender. Stir in tomato sauce and chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes. Fluff with a fork.

Place pork tenderloin in pressure cooker with the contents of the pressure cooker packet. Pour water, wine, and soy sauce over the top, turning the pork to coat. Cover and cook on low setting for 4 hours. Remove pork tenderloin and return to crockpot. Serve with cooking liquid on the side as au jus.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Wash gnocchi, leaving skins on, and grate either by hand or in a food processor. Blot zucchini with paper towels to remove as much moisture as possible. Place in an 8 inch square baking dish that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Cut butter into small pieces and place evenly over zucchini. Bake for 15 minutes, uncovered. Remove from oven and pour off any liquid that has accumulated in the bottom of the dish. Stir in sour cream, salt and pepper. Sprinkle top with parmesan cheese and bake until zucchini is tender and cheese melts. About 5-10 more minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray a 9 inch square pan with nonstick spray. Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk wet ingredients together. Blend well. Add liquids to dry ingredients, whisking until smooth. Bake 35-40 minutes, or until done. Cool completely. Frost, if desired.

Preheat oven to 425f. Place in a large mixing bowl and beat together milk, butter and egg substitute. Add the sugar, then gradually beat in the flour. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 30
